elements.title: Italian Campaign of 1796–1797 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Italian Campaign of 1796–1797 (battle pictured) demonstrated that Napoleon was a "great strategist"?

elements.title: Muhammad Khaznadar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Muhammad Khaznadar's museum was said to have "surpassed every other museum in the world" in Phoenician and Carthaginian antiquities?

elements.title: inspired the character of Prince Wheeliam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William, Prince of Wales, inspired the character of Prince Wheeliam in Cars 2?

elements.title: Hurry Up Tomorrow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hurry Up Tomorrow is planned to be the Weeknd's final album under his stage name?

elements.title: Columbus Airport (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Columbus Airport saw commercial air service before being certified for public use by the Civil Aeronautics Authority?

elements.title: Lisa Blatt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lisa Blatt, the first woman to argue 50 cases before the Supreme Court of the United States, "elicits laughs and the occasional sharp response from the justices"?

elements.title: a zero emission zone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Oxford is the first city in the United Kingdom to adopt a zero emission zone?

elements.title: Pachyballus ornatus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although Pachyballus ornatus is named for its bright pattern, the female is dark and plain while young?

elements.title: a four-year global search (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that retired model Leticia Sardá had no idea that she was the subject of a four-year global search?
